snippet: Former friends of Michael Forman, a career criminal, shared memories of his antics as a 17-year-old in 1959, which foreshadowed what was to come.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column examines life of career criminal Michael Forman, who turned 73 in May in a Brooklyn jail; Forman's University of Arizona classmates share memories of the tall tales he told them in 1959 that led them to believe he came from a world of wealth and lakeside estates; five decades later Forman sits in jail on a parole violation, his only legacy a trail of crimes and con jobs ranging from bad checks to murder.
lead_paragraph: Former friends of Michael Forman, a career criminal, shared memories of his antics as a 17-year-old in 1959, which foreshadowed what was to come.

headline.main: Painted by His Classmates: A Portrait of the Con Artist as a Young Man
